Package ohos.miscservices.timeutility

Class Timer

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.miscservices.timeutility.Timer

  • public class Timer
extends Object
    Provides applications with access to the timer system.

    Applications may need to perform an action at a specified time. Register Intent or ITimerListener with the timer system. When the registered timer goes off, the system sends the Intentto the application or calls the listener. Timers will be invalid after the system is powered off or restarted.

    Since:
    1

    • Nested Class Summary

      static interface  Timer.ITimerListener
      Provides a callback for a timer.

      Provides the oneshot timer function.
      static class  Timer.RepeatTimer
      Provides a repeating timer with a fixed interval for applications.
      static class  Timer.TimerIntent
      Creates an Intent data class to send after a timer is triggered.

      • TIMER_TYPE_EXACT

        public static final int TIMER_TYPE_EXACT
        Describes whether a timer will be delivered precisely at a scheduled time.

        If the bit flag is set to 1, the timer will be delivered as nearly as possible to the requested trigger time. However, this may result in high power consumption. An inexact timer will not be delivered precisely. This is to reduce the impact on device battery use. This type can be used in a combination with the other two types.

        Since:
        1
        See Also:
        TIMER_TYPE_REALTIME, TIMER_TYPE_WAKEUP, TIMER_TYPE_IDLE, Constant Field Values

      • TIMER_TYPE_IDLE

        public static final int TIMER_TYPE_IDLE
        Indicates whether the timer waking up the system is supported in low-power mode.

        If this bit is 1, the wakeup function is supported in low-power mode. This can cause heavy power consumption when the device is idle and reduce the battery life. Therefore, use such timers with caution. You can use them with timers of other types as a combination.

        Since:
        3
        See Also:
        TIMER_TYPE_REALTIME, TIMER_TYPE_EXACT, TIMER_TYPE_WAKEUP, Constant Field Values

      • TIMER_TYPE_REALTIME

        public static final int TIMER_TYPE_REALTIME
        Indicates the timing policy the timer use, which can be REALTIME or UTC.

        If the bit flag is set to 1, the timer adopts the REALTIME policy, indicating the time elapsed since the device boot. If the bit flag is set to 0, the timer adopts the UTC policy, indicating the time elapsed since 00:00:00 UTC on 1 January 1970. This type can be used in a combination with the other two types.

        Since:
        1
        See Also:
        TIMER_TYPE_WAKEUP, TIMER_TYPE_EXACT, TIMER_TYPE_IDLE, Constant Field Values

      • TIMER_TYPE_WAKEUP

        public static final int TIMER_TYPE_WAKEUP
        Describes whether a timer will wake the device up.

        If the bit flag is set to 1, this timer wakes the device up when the timer goes off, and the scheduled action is performed. A non-wakeup timer does not wake the device up, and the scheduled action will not be performed until the next time the device wakes up. This type can be used in a combination with the other two types.

        Since:
        1
        See Also:
        TIMER_TYPE_REALTIME, TIMER_TYPE_EXACT, TIMER_TYPE_IDLE, Constant Field Values
